segments.text: I can ’ t believe my English teacher is making me read pride and prejudice !
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Why not ! It ’ s a classic ; in fact , it ’ s one of my favorite novels .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Don ’ t judge a book by its cover . Do you Kwon what it ’ s about ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: First of all , it ’ s a romance novel , set in the early 19th century .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: I didn ’ t realize it was a romance novel . What ’ s the main storyline ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: It ’ s basically about a father who tried to marry off one of his five girls .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Why does he want to do that ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Since he doesn ’ t have a son , he hopes that one of the girls will marry a wealthy man . That way , all of his daughters will be cared for .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Won ’ t they get his inheritance ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: No , that ’ s the problem . Though they are well-off , once he dies , his house will go to his cousin . So , when he dies , the girls will have nothing .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: I see . This sounds interesting ! Maybe my teacher isn ’ t so horrible after all .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: So , are you going to read the novel or watch the movie ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: There ’ s movie ? My teacher didn ’ t tell me that !
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: That ’ s probably because she wants you to read the book first .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: It would take a lot less time ..
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: How about this . When you finish the book . I ’ ll get the movie and watch it with you .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Ok . That sounds like a deal .
segments.speaker: S1
